title: SCS ENGLISH 307-A-66 Advanced Reading and Writing Fiction I

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: Form, Structure, and Compression in the Short Story: time in this course will be divided between workshopping student stories and discussing published pieces, with a particular interest in what form stories take, how they build structure, and the use of compression and style to achieve depth. Students will write two short stories and revise one of them for a final project. Texts will include Denis Johnson, Flannery O'Connor, David Foster Wallace, and Best American Short Stories 2014. The course is for students who have taken courses in fiction or who have ficton writing experience.

descriptions.name: Registration Requirements
descriptions.value: ENGLISH 207, previous introductory level fiction writing course, or similar writing experience. Instructor's consent and confirmation of the prerequisite course or appropriate writing experience is required for enrollment in this course. Please send an email to the professor with your writing background to request a permission number.
